simple-cbir

A good starting point is the image package, since it contains the relevant information about image representation in the system where the rest of the program is based on.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
cbir
This package contains the test classes and different utility classes like the LabelUtils which are mandatory for the automation of the test-scenarios or the RFAssistant which is a helper class aimed to reduce consistency faults in the marking process.
cbir.image
The image representation is contained in this package.
cbir.interfaces
Definitions of the different interfaces implemented in this program can be found here.
cbir.metric
All implementations of the metric interface are located in this package.
cbir.reader
This package contains very simple implementations of descriptor readers.
cbir.retriever
In this package two implementations of image retrievers can be found.
cbir.score
This package contains different implementations of the scoring functions used for the nearest neighbor relevance feedback method.
ind.kdtree
This package contains a basic implementation of a kdtree index structure.
rf
Contains the different RF-methods and an utility class that is shared between all RF implementations.
rf.bayesian
Provides an implementation of the bayesian query shifting relevance feedback approach.
rf.mars
Provides implementations of the pseudo-RF methods presented in the MARS paper, which were adopted from text retrieval.
rf.nn
Provides a implementation of nearest neighbor based relevance feedback and is compatible with all the different scoring functions defined in the cbir.score package.

A good starting point is the image package, since it contains the relevant information about image representation in the system where the rest of the program is based on. The packages cbir.image, cbir.retriever, cbir.metric provide the core functionality of a cbir system.

The package cbir.reader is needed to feed previously generated image descriptors to our system. This is mandatory because the current system does not provide any feature extration functionality.

The packages ind.kdtree and rf.* are extensions that should improve the performance and the precision of the system. Due to the fact that our kd-tree implementation does not improve the performance you might want to change the index structure.

Informations about the usage of our system can be found in the README file and the example.pdf.
